Blog.post: Cypress / Afoot by Let's Active 1983/84 Revision after purchase : Let's Active is Mitch Easter's band (producer of Murmur, etc) and was apparently known to everyone from our parent's generation. But now is the time for the Jangle Rock Revival. Everything on this album is good--very tight, well assembled, but lacks some of the attacker power of early REM. From the liner notes : "A huge blast of lightning that summer blew up a lot of the equipment at the Drive-In, so we mixed Cypress at Reflection in Charlotte...We'd walk over to the Krispy Kreme every few mixes, which was another advantage of working there." urlLink Here's an mp3.

ok. an album new to me: phoenix "united" it dates back to the year 2000 and you've probably heard their song "too young," the golden track off of the lost in translation soundtrack. the rest of the album is pretty amazing. their story is that one of the members, branco, was in a band called darlin. they split up, some of darlin formed daft punk, branco went in a different direction with phoenix. there are some definite daft punk influences on one or two tracks, but all in all, the album is a winner. its been described as :'Undoubtedly the best post-French house, seventies Californian, country-rock concept album of modern love songs you'll ever likely to hear.' mmmm.

Evan told me about it. New Juana Molina CD just out. Go forth and buy. Update: This album is even sleepier than Segundo, the one that came before. There's more emphasis on vocal/guitar melodies than on layering and ambient electronic stuff. Still excellent. Still super sleepy. Still recommended.

Hey Jacob, This is a great idea for a blog, I always appreciate a heads up on good music. Five Eight and The Tom Collins Band were both at Music Midtown this year, ignorant non-Athens folk missed them in their haste to catch great acts like The Offspring and Puddle Of Mud. The new release "Five Eight" is REALLY GOOD. Some people just can't get used to the vocals, but at least his singing isn't generic. I've always liked this band, and some of it's best songs ever are on this release. Proof yet again that Athen's is a veritable breeding ground of great music.

Three by Archer Prewitt 2004 This album sounds like Matthew Sweet covering the Bee Gees. Also, the last half is really, really mellow. To be expected from the guitarist for the Sea and Cake. This is good background music. Unfortunately for your life, this album does not have the ability to change test scores or spontaneously cause graduation from college. urlLink MP3.
